summary: I love your fic recs!! I was wondering if you knew of any good fics with suave/confident Harry and flustered Draco? A post about...
question: I love your fic recs!! I was wondering if you knew of any good fics with suave/confident Harry and flustered Draco? A post about that came across my dash recently but without any recs (alas)! So I’m turning to you!! Thank you 💗💗💗
answer:
Hey. thank you, I’m so glad that you like them! I know I’ve definitely got some confident Harry ones but I’m not sure that all of them have flustered Draco but here are the ones that I’ve thought of, my dear :)

Two Playboys on the Pitch by Professor McKitten [archived by TheHexFiles_archivist] (Explicit, 48 K)

Summary: Harry’s a famous Quidditch player. Draco’s the Healer for a Quidditch team. They’re both known for their wild ways, but what happens when these two playboys meet after several years apart?

Naked by bixgirl1 (Explicit, 57 K)

Summary: Harry and Draco are sent on an undercover assignment to catch a Dark wizard — which might not be so bad if it weren’t at a Muggle nudist resort.

Now Draco has to deal with a very interested Harry, temptation he’s long-since learned to ignore, and threats around every corner — including the one to his heart.

Luckiest Fucking Size Queen Alive by loveglowsinthedark (Explicit, 6.2 K)

Summary: Potter escorts me home, presses me into my front door and kisses me with a ferocity that’s exhilarating.

And then Potter asks me, in a growl that makes my cock throw a wet tantrum in my pants, how many more dates I would deem mandatory before I let him fuck me.

I drag Potter to bed.

Nearly Lost Things, Carefully Tended by SquadOfCats (Explicit, 46 K)

Summary: Three years after the war, Harry is lost, drifting, and feeling left behind. In an effort to get control of his life, he commits to cleaning out Grimmauld Place top-to-bottom and forcing it to be a home, whether it likes it or not. The rotten old house is stuffed full of antiques, and Harry is shocked to discover none other than Draco Malfoy running the local antique shop. Malfoy is polite – too polite, and Harry soon finds himself with a mission: to annoy and bother Malfoy with the most hideous, absurd antiques he can find. But along the way, Harry comes to appreciate Draco, his work, and the power of connecting to the people who came before him. It’s a hard lesson, but Harry learns that if he wants to build a future, he has to reconnect to his past, and Draco might just be the one to help him do it.

summary:
Does anyone else think the Prisoner of Azkaban game is amazing or...? I mean:
You get to play as Harry, Ron AND Hermione, and...
body:
Does anyone else think the Prisoner of Azkaban game is amazing or…? I mean:

  • You get to play as Harry, Ron AND Hermione, and you can regularly switch between them
  • Each of them have certain skills: Harry can jump large distances and shimmy on ledges, Ron can find hidden passages and search bookcases for beans/dungbombs, Hermione can crawl into smaller spaces and has the most spells etc.
  • Free-roam of the Hogwarts castle
  • At one point you play as Hedwig and you fly to get the Marauders Map
  • Flipendo!
  • Peeves appears
  • Duelling club
  • You get to fly on Buckbeak
  • For some weird reason when Snape catches you after hours, he coughs and splutters

Just me who loves this game or…?

summary: Love Fools Chapter 1: Can’t Be Helped
title: Love Fools Chapter 1: Can’t Be Helped
body:
Pairing: Severus Snape x Reader

Reader: Reader was chosen by an applewood wand and has the uncommon ability of chatting with magical creatures and beings in their own tongues.  Imagine they’re also quite gifted with language in general, like Fudge and Dumbledore.

Word Count: 1,427

Chapters: Masterpost || Next Chapter

A/N: I sneezed and my hand slipped while writing, so what was supposed to be a ficlet became a one-shot…and then that one-shot became a longfic.  Oops.  I blame it on my love for Slytherin characters.  Anyways, this starts off during the First Wizarding War, pre-prophecy, and the Reader is also a Death Eater.  This is a series to explore the greyness and complexity of Severus’ character.

As the Dark Lord’s liaison for the giants, you traveled a great deal between the Death Eater headquarters and the many colonies of giants.  It was your job to keep things smooth and pass along messages, since Voldemort preferred to visit the colony as little as possible due to his distaste for the beings.

You had been away for a couple of days, engaging in some delicate discussions with a handful of leaders from different colonies.  The aurors were starting to take down too many of their brethren for comfort and they were beginning to grow cold feet as a consequence.  The Dark Lord would not be pleased with either their requests for him to show in person or their request of Death Eaters as back up for their raids on Muggle towns and cities.

You felt tired just thinking about it and slumped yourself in an overstuffed chair in the library’s sitting area, not sure what to really do with yourself until the meeting in a couple of hours.

“I see you’ve returned.”  Hearing the cold, but familiar drawl put a weak smile on your face and you turned your face to look at its source.  He was the reason you were here with a Dark Mark etched visibly into your left forearm, for better or worse.

“It’s good to see you too, Sev.”  

Seating himself in the chair across from you, Snape sat down a couple of leather bound books on the coffee table between you.  Both of them looked old and the gilded script on the first one’s cover wasn’t in English…or any other human script for that matter.

“Ooh, are these …?”

“In Gobbledegook?  Indeed.”  Pushing them toward you before leaning back in his seat, he was quick to avert his gaze out the nearby window and let his dark curtains of greasy hair obscure his face.  “I thought they might be of interest to you …”

You couldn’t help but smile at the gesture and were quick to pick up the top book and giving it a quick look over before turning your attention to the second.  “They absolutely are, thank you.  It looks like one’s a compendium of famous goblin-made artifacts and the other is about goblin history with a focus on their rebellions.”

“How was your visit with the giants?  You were gone longer than anticipated.”

“Terrible.”  That seemed to catch Severus’ attention as he turned to look back at you.  “The aurors are getting more efficient at felling them and they’re starting to reconsider the terms of their argument with the Dark Lord.  They’re now requesting his presence at a summit in a couple weeks time for some potential renegotiations.”

“Yes, I was afraid that would be the case.  The Dark Lord will not be pleased.”  He turned his face away from you again, but you were able to catch the small frown and crease between his eyebrows.

“I know, I’m not looking forward to reporting about it in front of everyone, but it’ll be okay.  It always is.”  Truly, you dreaded what was to follow after when you had to go into more detail with him in private and receive your punishment for failing.  As unfair as it was, the Dark Lord would view this as a failure on your part.

You saw Severus visibly tense at that, his fingers practically digging into the arms of the chair.  Even if you couldn’t see it, you got the impression that he was giving the gloomy courtyard outside one of his withering death stares.  

“Severus?”

“I’m sorry.”

“… Pardon me?”  

“I’m sorry.”  It was quieter this time, softer as if there was some barely repressed emotion attempting to seep out.

“But what…what are you sorry for?  This isn’t your fault.”

“You don’t belong here.”  The softness was gone, a cold edge took its place, the abruptness of it was enough to make you flinch.  “Yet you joined because of me, didn’t you?”

“N-No, I—”

“Didn’t you?” He didn’t raise his voice, he didn’t even have to.  He wasn’t asking you, he was commanding you and it was clear that there wasn’t any room for.  It was rare for him to direct that way of speaking to you, which made it all the more effective.

Fidgeting with the book in your hands, you could only stare at it as if it was the most interesting thing you had ever seen.  “Yes, I did.”

An uncomfortable silence hung over the pair of you for a few moments, you felt tears beginning to well up and soon your vision was thoroughly blurred.  You didn’t look up even when he stated your name, “You are a fool.”

His tone wasn’t as harsh, instead it was something softer, most likely pity.  His expression of emotions was typically far subtler than other people, but you had put in a concerted effort into.  Still, he wasn’t wrong.  You were a fool.  Giving up so much just to follow the man you were hopelessly in love with?  A terribly foolish thing, indeed.  There was no debating that.

After a few moments passed and you didn’t refute him or even say anything further, Severus stood up.  In your peripheral vision, you could see the blur of his black robes and by some subconscious impulse, you ended up reaching out and gently grasping his wrist.  Even though you knew you must have looked pathetic in that moment, you forced yourself to look up at him.

His expression was a blank mask as he looked down at you over his hooked nose, you managed to give him a weak smile before saying, “You’re just as much of a fool as I am, Sev.” 

“I know.”  

“It’s really not your fault.  None of this is”—you released his wrist—”since I think we both know that this sort of thing can’t be helped.”

His mask had broken and even with your blurred vision you could practically see see a series of complex emotions pass over his face, as his eyebrows twitched and lips quivered.  It took him a few moments to settle on pressing his lips together.

You were surprised when he exhaled heavily from his nose before reaching a hand down and gently wiped a tear away with the back of his curved index finger.  You hadn’t even been aware that your tears were beginning to overflow.

“You know how I detest crying.”  The wry delivery was enough to get a small chuckle out of you, which in turn put a small smile on his face. “Regardless, I’m afraid that my particular brand of foolishness is more…complicated than you know.”

“What do you—“

“Well, well…  What have we here?” Malfoy sounded unmistakably pleased, you could imagine the smirk on his face from his place in the doorway behind you.  Saying that you felt displeasure at his sudden appearance was a massive understatement. 

Severus’ expression almost instantaneously shifted back to something entirely neutral before he dropped his hand back to his side.  “It is none of your concern, Lucius.” 

Your companion took his leave from your side then, his bat-like robes billowing about him as he strode to meet your fellow Death Eater.  You were quick to wipe the tears away from your face, doing what you could to make yourself look presentable.

“I suppose it isn’t, but can you blame me for my curiosity?”

“Absolutely: when it’s not your business to be curious about.”

There was a beat when you heard Severus’s footsteps pause and you assumed that the two of them shared a look during it before the subject of your affections left the room.

Lucius called out your name and you craned your neck to look at him.  “The Dark Lord requests your presence in his office most urgently.  He does not wish to wait until the meeting to hear of what news you have.”

It was most unwise to keep the Dark Lord waiting, especially when you didn’t even have good news to report.  Knowing such, you quickly stood up and began to gather up your new books with trembling hands, dread already building up in your stomach.

“I’ll be right there.  Thank you, Malfoy.”

He gave you a curt nod before leaving you alone.  With your books clutched to your chest, you did your best to steel your nerves before exiting the library with your head held high.  

It would pass and now you at least had a conversation you looked forward to continue.  Even with it all, you couldn’t truly regret the path you had chosen.  

Not yet.
body_abstract:
Pairing: Severus Snape x Reader

Reader: Reader was chosen by an applewood wand and has the uncommon ability of chatting with magical creatures and beings in their own tongues.  Imagine they’re also quite gifted with language in general, like Fudge and Dumbledore.

Word Count: 1,427

Chapters: Masterpost || Next Chapter

A/N: I sneezed and my hand slipped while writing, so what was supposed to be a ficlet became a one-shot…and then that one-shot became a longfic.  Oops.  I blame it on my love for Slytherin characters.  Anyways, this starts off during the First Wizarding War, pre-prophecy, and the Reader is also a Death Eater.  This is a series to explore the greyness and complexity of Severus’ character.

As the Dark Lord’s liaison for the giants, you traveled a great deal between the Death Eater headquarters and the many colonies of giants.  It was your job to keep things smooth and pass along messages, since Voldemort preferred to visit the colony as little as possible due to his distaste for the beings.

You had been away for a couple of days, engaging in some delicate discussions with a handful of leaders from different colonies.  The aurors were starting to take down too many of their brethren for comfort and they were beginning to grow cold feet as a consequence.  The Dark Lord would not be pleased with either their requests for him to show in person or their request of Death Eaters as back up for their raids on Muggle towns and cities.

You felt tired just thinking about it and slumped yourself in an overstuffed chair in the library’s sitting area, not sure what to really do with yourself until the meeting in a couple of hours.

“I see you’ve returned.”  Hearing the cold, but familiar drawl put a weak smile on your face and you turned your face to look at its source.  He was the reason you were here with a Dark Mark etched visibly into your left forearm, for better or worse.

Severus’ expression almost instantaneously shifted back to something entirely neutral before he dropped his hand back to his side.  “It is none of your concern, Lucius.” 

Your companion took his leave from your side then, his bat-like robes billowing about him as he strode to meet your fellow Death Eater.  You were quick to wipe the tears away from your face, doing what you could to make yourself look presentable.

“I suppose it isn’t, but can you blame me for my curiosity?”

“Absolutely: when it’s not your business to be curious about.”

There was a beat when you heard Severus’s footsteps pause and you assumed that the two of them shared a look during it before the subject of your affections left the room.

Lucius called out your name and you craned your neck to look at him.  “The Dark Lord requests your presence in his office most urgently.  He does not wish to wait until the meeting to hear of what news you have.”

It was most unwise to keep the Dark Lord waiting, especially when you didn’t even have good news to report.  Knowing such, you quickly stood up and began to gather up your new books with trembling hands, dread already building up in your stomach.

“I’ll be right there.  Thank you, Malfoy.”

He gave you a curt nod before leaving you alone.  With your books clutched to your chest, you did your best to steel your nerves before exiting the library with your head held high.  

It would pass and now you at least had a conversation you looked forward to continue.  Even with it all, you couldn’t truly regret the path you had chosen.  

Not yet.
trail.content_abstract:
Pairing: Severus Snape x Reader

Reader: Reader was chosen by an applewood wand and has the uncommon ability of chatting with magical creatures and beings in their own tongues.  Imagine they’re also quite gifted with language in general, like Fudge and Dumbledore.

Word Count: 1,427

Chapters: Masterpost || Next Chapter

A/N: I sneezed and my hand slipped while writing, so what was supposed to be a ficlet became a one-shot…and then that one-shot became a longfic.  Oops.  I blame it on my love for Slytherin characters.  Anyways, this starts off during the First Wizarding War, pre-prophecy, and the Reader is also a Death Eater.  This is a series to explore the greyness and complexity of Severus’ character.

As the Dark Lord’s liaison for the giants, you traveled a great deal between the Death Eater headquarters and the many colonies of giants.  It was your job to keep things smooth and pass along messages, since Voldemort preferred to visit the colony as little as possible due to his distaste for the beings.

You had been away for a couple of days, engaging in some delicate discussions with a handful of leaders from different colonies.  The aurors were starting to take down too many of their brethren for comfort and they were beginning to grow cold feet as a consequence.  The Dark Lord would not be pleased with either their requests for him to show in person or their request of Death Eaters as back up for their raids on Muggle towns and cities.

You felt tired just thinking about it and slumped yourself in an overstuffed chair in the library’s sitting area, not sure what to really do with yourself until the meeting in a couple of hours.

“I see you’ve returned.”  Hearing the cold, but familiar drawl put a weak smile on your face and you turned your face to look at its source.  He was the reason you were here with a Dark Mark etched visibly into your left forearm, for better or worse.

body:
Coffee

Draco wanted to cry. He really did. Only his energy was limited, and he’d already spent it all on curling up in a ball on the break room couch. Which meant that now he could only stare at the tiny kitchen, eyes glassy and heart filled with betreyal.

Empty.

It was empty.

He could already feel his migrane set in.

“Draco? Are you alright? What are you doing here? Didn’t night shift end like two hours ago?”

Draco would be pissed if he had the energy for it. Fucking Potter stood in the door opening, with his stupid hair and his stupid skinny jeans and his stupid muscled arms which he had no right to have! Potter had quit the aurors and now worked at a small coffeeshop as barista.

Which reminded Draco of his own terrible fate.

“Coffee’s gone. I had overtime and now it’s gone.” Tears actually fell from his eyes now. “Stupid morning shift drank it all.”

“Oh honey.” Potter was at his side in an instant, pulling him in a bone crushing hug. “You really hate your job, don’t you?”

“No. I just want coffee.” Draco hated how small his voice was. “I can manage with coffee.”

“We’ll get you coffee, don’t you worry love.” Potter kissed the side of his head. “I’ll apparate us to my work and make my first cup just for you, how does that sound?”

Draco didn’t respond. He was fighting sleep in Potter’s arms. His nightmares were horror when he slept alone, and after three night shifts that meant he was dead on his feet.

“Please say something love.” Potter squeezed him and kissed him again. “You know I hate seeing my husband upset.”

Draco grumbled. Mentioning their marriage was cheating. It always made him soft. That was why he called his husband Potter. Otherwise he would never be able to insult Potter or say no to the specky git ever again.

Prick.

“Fine,” he muttered eventually. Potter dragged him up and guided him to the apparation zone. “I hate you.”

“You hate everything without coffee.” Potter chuckled.

“I hate everything with coffee too.” Draco shot back. “Prick.”

“I love you too, Draco.” Potter chuckled again. Draco wanted to punch him, but ended up kissing him on the lips.

“Coffee. Now.” Draco glared the smile right off of his husband’s face. “It’s the only reason I married you, so now don’t make me regret it.”

“I wouldn’t dream of it Draco.” Potter smirked, and they spun on the spot.

Draco might not have said it out loud, but that didn’t make it any less true; he loved Harry. He just wasn’t going to say that until he’d had his third espresso.

blog.name: evergreen-promo
blog.title: Welcome to Evergreen University!
blog.description: Please find us at Evergreen-u!

summary:
Opened in 1850 by Delilah Evergreen the Evergreen University has been
 helping students with their higher education for years....
caption:
Opened in 1850 by Delilah Evergreen the Evergreen University has been helping students with their higher education for years. Offering a variety of programs including business, muggle studies, and healing, this is the perfect place to expand your worldview and get all the skills you need in your future profession.

The date is August 21st 2025. Unlike Hogwarts, Evergreen University is hidden in several buildings around London. Headmistress Zelda Marigold wants to modernize the school and encourages students to use technology. Professors from all backgrounds are welcome at the school, as Miss. Marigold looks for the most qualified of teachers.

Are you interested in continuing your education? Do you want a lowkey, fun RP group that mixes canon and OCs? This is the place for you! Feel free to send an ask in or an app. We’re always happy to answer your questions!

                                        Home || Apply || Characters || Rules
